#### _Synopsis of some of the major pandemics, in chronological order, compiled based on the severity of the disease in terms of death toll._

Date | Pandemic name | Death toll
------------- | ----- | ------ | -------------
430 BC | The plague of Athens | 25% of population
1347–1351 | Black death | 200M
1520-onward	| New world smallpox | 56M	
1885 |	Third plague | 12M
1918–1919 |	Spanish flu |	40–50M
1981–present |	AIDS |	25–35M
2009–2010	| Swine flu |	200K
2019–present |	COVID-19 |	>0.5M
	
Source: Extracted from [The National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM) ](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC7426550/table/t4-rmmj-11-3-e0027/?report=objectonly).
